basics.name: Anders Marzi Tornblad
basics.label: Software Architect
basics.summary: I have spent more than 20 years as a professional within software development, doing solution architecture, integrations, software architecture, database design, information analysis, web application architecture, technical project management, and good old code-writing. Some of the technologies/stacks I enjoy working in are: Java, C#, ElasticSearch, Docker, Kubernetes, React, Android, Azure, and AWS.

work.name: The Gothenburg Region
work.description: Cooperative association for 13 municipalities in the general Gothenburg area

work.name: Meltwater
work.description: Providing solutions that help customers make more informed decisions

work.name: Combination AB
work.description: Creating state-of-the-art solutions for Sportsbook and online casino apps
work.summary: Acting as hiring manager for a small team, and also doing full-stack development in advanced solutions requiring high performance, zero downtime and near real-time updates, using a wide range of technology, such as Docker, Kubernetes, ElasticSearch, SignalR, Azure DevOps.

work.name: Infracontrol AB
work.description: With over 140 cities in Sweden and Portugal as customers, Infracontrol Online is a system with high demands for performance and useability
work.summary: Some of my responsibilities were to investigate different options and then execute a large migration of on-premise data and services to a Microsoft Azure-based cloud solution and develop integrations to communicate with bespoke customer systems.

work.name: Volvo Car Retail Solutions AB
work.description: Developing simple and intuitive digital solutions that make Volvo Retail run smooth
work.summary: I performed an architectural review to get to the bottom with low development velocity and poor quality in one of the company's flagship products. My recommendation was to simplify and rebuild large parts of the product's backend, and to introduce a more agile approach to project management. One challenge was to deal with integrations with external systems, and Microsoft BizTalk Server was the technology of choice.
